intro: Pavetta caffra, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in woodland and thicket habitats, often as a shrub or small tree. Pavetta caffra is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in various African cultures for its purported health benefits.
